intro: Secamone letouzeana, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in a star-like pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
